about.title: What is Mexican Loteria? History and Tradition | chorroybuenas.com.mx
about.metaDescription: Discover the history, culture and tradition behind Mexican Loteria. Learn about its origins and how it has united communities for generations.

header.title: What is Mexican Loteria?
header.subtitle: Learn more about this traditional game that is part of Mexican culture

history.title: History and Origin
history.text: Loteria is a traditional Mexican game of chance, similar to bingo, which has been a staple of Mexican culture for generations. Originating in Europe as "Lotto," it was brought to Mexico during the colonial era. Over time, it evolved into a deeply rooted tradition, reflecting local art and culture, and becoming a centerpiece of Mexican festivals and family gatherings.

culture.title: Culture and Tradition
culture.text: It is a game that has united families and communities for generations, especially during festivals and celebrations. Mexican Loteria is not just a game; it's a living tradition passed down within families, creating lasting memories of shared joy and connection.

traditionalGame.title: The Traditional Game
traditionalGame.text: Traditionally, Mexican Loteria uses a deck with 54 cards, each with characteristic images such as "El Gallo" (The Rooster), "El Diablito" (The Little Devil), "La Dama" (The Lady), among others. Boards have 16 images distributed in a 4x4 grid, and the goal is to complete lines or fill the entire board while the "announcer" draws and calls out the cards in a rhythmic and fun way.

customLoteria.title: Custom Loteria
customLoteria.text: With our app, you can keep this tradition alive by creating custom loterias for any special occasion. Whether for a baby shower, a birthday party, a family event, or any celebration, you can create a unique loteria with your own images and themes, making each game special and memorable.

cta.text: Customize your game with your own images and enjoy this Mexican tradition

howToPlay.title: How to play Mexican Loteria? - Step-by-Step Instructions | chorroybuenas.com.mx
howToPlay.metaDescription: Learn how to play Mexican Loteria step by step. Clear instructions to prepare the game, call the cards and win. Have fun with tradition!

header.title: How to play Mexican Loteria?
header.subtitle: Learn how to play this fun traditional Mexican game step by step

step1.title: Prepare the game
step1.text: Each player receives a board with 16 unique images arranged in a 4x4 grid. Designate one person as the "announcer" who will be in charge of drawing and calling the cards.

step2.title: Game starts
step2.text: The announcer draws cards from the deck one by one and calls them in a fun and rhythmic way, announcing the name or description of the image. Players mark the cards that appear on their board using beans, coins or any marker.

step3.title: Win with different patterns
step3.text: The goal is to complete one of the agreed patterns (Line, Center, Corners, or Full Board). Only the first person to complete a specific play wins that prize; once claimed, that play is closed for others. When you complete a pattern, shout "Line!", "Center!" or the name of the corresponding play to win.

step4.title: Shouting Loteria and End of Round
step4.text: When a player fills their entire board, they shout "Loteria!". At that moment, the game stops to verify the cards. If correct, the round ends, the grand prize is awarded, and everything is reset to start again.

betting.title: Bets and Boards
betting.text: Each participant contributes a set amount of money for each board they wish to play with (players can use one or more boards). The total money collected (pot) is divided among the winning plays.

patterns.title: Plays and Prizes
patterns.fullBoard: Full Board: The grand prize, won by completing all images on the board.
patterns.line: Line (Chorro): Won by completing a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line.
patterns.center: Center: Won by marking the 4 cards in the center of the board.
patterns.corners: 4 Corners: Won by marking the cards in the four corners.

step3.text: Write a descriptive name for your card. This will be the text called out during the game

step4.title: Add the card

recommendations.title: Recommendations for best results
recommendations.quality: Use high-quality images: Avoid blurry or pixelated images so they look sharp on the boards
recommendations.subject: Focus on the main subject: Images with a clearly visible object or person work best
recommendations.lighting: Good lighting: Choose well-lit photos so details are better appreciated
recommendations.vibrant: Vibrant colors: Images with vivid colors and clear contrasts stand out more
recommendations.composition: Centered composition: The editor allows you to crop and adjust, but it's better to start with a well-framed image
recommendations.descriptive: Descriptive titles: Choose titles that are easy to identify and fun to "call out"
